dtl_desc: TO ELECT JIM WRIGHT OF TEXAS AS SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES. Y=JIM WRIGHT (D,TX)     N=ROBERT H. MICHEL (R,IL)
TO ORDER H RES 5, RULES OF THE HOUSE, WITH AN AMENDMENT TO REQUIRE TELEVISED PROCEEDINGS FOR THE HEARING-IMPAIRED, TO TO ESTABLISH A HOUSE HISTORIAN, AND TO INCREASE THE SIZE OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE.

TO ADJOURN THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES TO THEREBY PREVENT CONSIDERATION OF A PRIVILEGED MOTION TO FORCE A VOTE ON PROPOSED PAY RAISES FOR CONGRESS AND OTHER FEDERAL OFFICIALS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H J RES 129, FEDERAL PAY RAISE DISAPPROVAL TO REJECT THE PRESIDENT'S RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CERTAIN LEGISLATIVE, JUDICIAL, AND EXECUTIVE BRANCH SALARY INCREASES. (MOTION PASSED; TWO-THIRDS OF THOSE PRESENT VOTING IN FAVOR).
TO ADOPT HR 1231, EASTERN AIRLINES STRIKE RESOLUTION, TO REQUIRE THE PRESIDENT TO ESTABLISH AN EMERGENCY BOARD TO MEDIATE BETWEEN MANAGEMENT AND MACHINISTS AT EASTERN AIRLINES.
TO PASS HR 1231, EASTERN AIRLINES STRIKE RESOLUTION, A BILL TO REQUIRE THE PRESIDENT TO ESTABLISH AN EMERGENCY BOARD TO MEDIATE BETWEEN MANAGEMENT AND MACHINISTS AT EASTERN AIRLINES.

TO AMEND HR 2, MINIMUM WAGE INCREASE, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO INCREASE THE MINIMUM WAGE OVER A THREE-YEAR PERIOD AND ESTABLISH A LOWER TRAINING WAGE.

TO AMEND HR 2, MINIMUM WAGE INCREASE, TO INCREASE CIVIL PENALTIES FOR EMPLOYERS WHO VIOLATE THE MINIMUM WAGE RULES AND FAIR LABOR STANDARDS ACT REQUIREMENTS.
TO PASS HR 2, MINIMUM WAGE INCREASE, TO INCREASE THE MINIMUM WAGE FROM $3.35 TO $4.55 OVER THREE YEARS AND TO PROVIDE A TWO-MONTH TRAINING WAGE.
TO APPROVE THE HOUSE JOURNAL OF TUESDAY, APRIL 4.
TO PASS HR 18, UNIFORM POLL CLOSING, TO ESTABLISH A SINGLE POLL CLOSING TIME IN THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES FOR PRESIDENTIAL GENERAL ELECTIONS.

TO PASS HR 1487, STATE DEPARTMENT AUTHORIZATION, FISCAL 1990-91, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE $4.68 BILLION FOR FISCAL YEARS 1990 AND 1991 FOR OPERATIONS OF THE STATE DEPARTMENT AND OTHER FOREIGN AFFAIRS AGENCIES.

TO APPROVE THE HOUSE JOURNAL OF MONDAY, APRIL 17.

TO AMEND HR 7, VOCATIONAL EDUCATION REAUTHORIZATION, TO PROHIBIT USE OF FUNDS AVAILABLE BY THIS ACT TO ANY EDUCATIONAL AGENCY EFFECTIVELY PREVENTING INDIVIDUALS FROM PARTICIPATING IN PRAYER ON A VOLUNTARY BASIS.

(MOTION PASSED;  TWO-THIRDS OF THOSE PRESENT HAVING VOTED IN FAVOR).

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS HR 2145, UNITED NATIONS CONTRIBUTIONS, TO PROHIBIT U. S. CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE UNITED NATIONS OR ANY OF ITS AFFILIATED ORGANIZATIONS IF MEMBERSHIP AS A STATE IS GRANTED TO ANY ORGANIZATION OR GROUP NOT HAVING INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED ATTRIBUTES OF STATEHOOD.
